intro: Cornutia grandifolia, commonly known as the largeflower cornutia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a compact, shrub-like form. Cornutia grandifolia is often found in woodlands and swampy areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
